job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Bangor, ME
pros: Get hours in 2-4 days, always overtime, pay is above minimum, growth within company, rewarding, flexible
cons: Short staffed, sometimes stressful, call outs

job_title: Community Support Supervisor in Bangor, ME
pros: Wonderful managers, amazing clients, locations are convenient.
cons: Expected to work for salary around 70+ hours a week. It’s frowned upon when you don’t and they call you out on in. Office staff and executives unwilling to help inside of the group homes and instead will have their DSPs and supervisors work upward of 80+ hours a week. Unrealistic expectations for very very low pay.

job_title: Community Support Supervisor in Bangor, ME
pros: Long-standing relationship in the community. Provides excellent services.
Great benefits, paid training, amazing co-workers, room for growth, leaders who are involved in day to day activities, incentives for extra $$$
cons: The base rate of pay is on the lower end, staffing is a challenge

review_title: Great place to work with people with disabilities.
pros: Family atmosphere. Encourages lots of community involvement.
cons: Low pay and no real incentives for dedicated long-term employees.

review_title: the job took some time to get used to but not hard.
